title: About Us
text:
Our Research and Extension Cropping Systems Weed Science Program (WiscWeeds) at the University of Wisconsin-Madison focuses on traditional and agroecologically-based approaches to weed management in corn, soybean, and small grains in Wisconsin farm systems. Our program generates and disseminates research-based information for sustainable weed management (including herbicide-resistant weeds), protecting water quality, increasing food security, and enhancing other agroecosystem services (e.g., farm profitability). Check the WiscWeeds Team Program Statement.



WiscWeeds team at the 2022 North Central Weed Science Society Meetings, St. Louis, MO, December 07, 2022.

title: 2022 Wisconsin Weed Science Research Report
text: The purpose of this report is to share the results of 18 corn and soybean herbicide evaluation research trials conducted by the Wisconsin Cropping Systems Weed Science Program during the 2022 growing season. Information in this report does not constitute a recommendation or endorsement of any particular product or practice. Information in this report also does not replace any information presented on herbicide labels.

title: 2022 Wisconsin Weed Science Research Report
section: To download the 2021 Wisconsin Weed Science Research Report, CLICK HERE (PDF)

title: 2022 Wisconsin Weed Science Research Report
text:
2022 Visual Research Reports
The purpose of the visual research reports is to share field images from some of the corn and soybean herbicide evaluation research trials conducted by the Wisconsin Cropping Systems Weed Science Program during the 2022 growing season.
2022 Corn Weed Control Trials (field images):

Acuron GT Performance Demo (PDF)
Corn Herbicide Showcase 1 and 2-Pass Programs with Atrazine (PDF)
Corn Herbicide Showcase 1 and 2-Pass Programs without Atrazine (PDF)
Evaluation of Corn PRE-Emergence Herbicides - Janesville (PDF)
Evaluation of Corn PRE-Emergence Herbicides - Lancaster (PDF)
Herbicide Programs for Conventional Corn - Arlington (PDF)
Herbicide Programs for Conventional Corn - Brooklyn (PDF)
POST and Sequential Weed Control with Maverick (PDF)

2022 Soybean Weed Control Trials (field images):

Authority Brand Soybean Herbicide Programs - Brooklyn (PDF)
Authority Brand Soybean Herbicide Programs - Janesville (PDF)
Evaluation of Layered Residual Herbicide Programs in Enlist Soybean (PDF)
Evaluation of Tendovo for Residual Weed Control and Crop Safety (PDF)
Preview 2.1SC Herbicide Programs in Enlist Soybean (PDF)
Reviton Burndown Programs in Soybean (PDF)
Waterhemp Management in Early Planted Enlist Soybean (PDF)
XtendFlex Soybean Herbicide Program Recommendations without Dicamba (PDF)
XtendFlex Soybean Herbicide Programs (PDF)
XtendFlex Soybean Herbicide Programs for ESA Counties (PDF)
XtendiMax Paired Soil Residual Herbicide Programs (PDF)

Kudos to Ryan DeWerff (UW-Madison Weed Science Research Specialist and WI Herbicide Evaluation Program Coordinator) for generating these reports and to our entire WiscWeeds team for their great work supporting the research reported herein. Many thanks to our collaborators and sponsors (all listed in the report).



2022 WiscWeeds Team
